verses.verse: Israel<WH3478> is a luxuriant<WH1238> vine<WH1612> that puts forth<WH7737> his fruit.<WH6529> According to the abundance<WH7230> of his fruit<WH6529> he has multiplied<WH7235> his altars.<WH4196> As their land<WH776> has prospered,<WH2896> they have adorned their sacred<WH2895> stones.<WH4676>
Their heart<WH3820> is divided.<WH2505> Now they will be found guilty.<WH816> He will demolish<WH6202> their altars.<WH4196> He will destroy<WH7703> their sacred stones.<WH4676>
Surely now they will say,<WH559> "We have no king;<WH4428> for we don't<WH3372> fear Yahweh;<WH3068> and the king,<WH4428> what can he do for us?<WH6213>"

They make<WH1696> promises,<WH1697> swearing<WH422> falsely<WH7723> in making<WH3772> covenants.<WH1285> Therefore judgment<WH4941> springs up<WH6524> like poisonous weeds<WH7219> in the furrows<WH8525> of the field.<WH7704>

The inhabitants<WH7934> of Samaria<WH8111> will be in terror<WH1481> for the calves<WH5697> of Beth Aven;<WH1007> for its people<WH5971> will mourn<WH56> over it,<WH3649> Along with its priests who rejoiced<WH1523> over it,<WH3519> for its glory, because it has departed from it.<WH1540>

It also will be carried<WH2986> to Assyria<WH804> for a present<WH4503> to a great king.<WH4428> <WH3377> Ephraim<WH669> will receive<WH3947> shame,<WH1317> and Israel<WH3478> will be ashamed<WH954> of his own counsel.<WH6098>
Samaria<WH8111> and her king<WH4428> float away,<WH1820> like a twig<WH7110> on<WH6440> the water.<WH4325>

The high places<WH1116> also of Aven,<WH206> the sin<WH2403> of Israel,<WH3478> will be destroyed.<WH8045> The thorn<WH6975> and the thistle<WH1863> will come up<WH5927> on their altars.<WH4196> They will tell<WH559> the mountains,<WH2022> "Cover<WH3680> us!<WH1389>" and the hills, "Fall on us!<WH5307>"

"Israel,<WH3478> you have sinned<WH2398> from the days<WH3117> of Gibeah.<WH1390> There they remained.<WH5975> The battle<WH4421> against the children<WH1121> of iniquity<WH5932> doesn't<WH5381> overtake them in Gibeah.<WH1390>
When it is my desire,<WH185> I will chastise<WH3256> them;<WH5971> and the nations will be gathered<WH622> against them,<WH631> when they are bound to their two<WH8147> transgressions.<WH5869>

Ephraim<WH669> is a trained<WH3925> heifer<WH5697> that loves<WH157> to thresh;<WH1758> so I will put a yoke<WH5674> on her beautiful<WH2898> neck.<WH6677> I will set a rider<WH7392> on Ephraim.<WH669> Judah<WH3063> will plow.<WH2790> Jacob<WH3290> will break his clods.<WH7702>

Sow<WH2232> to yourselves in<WH6310> righteousness,<WH6666> reap<WH7114> according to kindness.<WH2617> Break up<WH5214> your fallow ground;<WH5215> for it is time<WH6256> to seek<WH1875> Yahweh,<WH3068> until he comes<WH935> and rains<WH3384> righteousness on you.<WH6664>

You have plowed<WH2790> wickedness.<WH7562> You have reaped<WH7114> iniquity.<WH5766> You have eaten<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> of lies,<WH3585> for you trusted<WH982> in your way,<WH1870> in the multitude<WH7230> of your mighty men.<WH1368>

Therefore a battle roar<WH7588> will arise<WH6965> among your people,<WH5971> and all your fortresses<WH4013> will be destroyed,<WH7703> as Shalman<WH8020> destroyed<WH7701> Beth Arbel<WH1009> in the day<WH3117> of battle.<WH4421> The mother<WH517> was dashed in pieces<WH7376> with her children.<WH1121>
So<WH3602> Bethel<WH1008> will do<WH6213> to you because<WH6440> of your great<WH7451> wickedness.<WH7451> At daybreak<WH7837> the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> will be<WH1820> destroyed.<WH1820>
